column1: Periventricular leukomalacia (PVL) is a type of brain injury that affects infants.
The damage creates "holes" in the brain.
A major cause is thought to be changes in blood flow to the area around the ventricles of the brain.
Premature babies who have intraventricular hemorrhage (IVH) are also at increased risk for developing this condition.
Tests used to diagnose PVL include ultrasound and MRI of the head.
